episodeTitle: Straw Hats in Shock! The Bad News Has Reached Them!
description: The scattered Straw Hat crew members, each in their own training locations, receive devastating news about Ace's death at Marineford through newspapers delivered by News Coos. The episode shows how each crew member reacts to learning about their captain's tragic loss.

events.title: Zoro Battles the Humandrills
events.description: On Kuraigana Island, Zoro confronts a group of Humandrills - highly intelligent man-sized apes capable of using weapons. Still recovering from his wounds from Bartholomew Kuma, Zoro struggles against the overwhelming numbers.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's current weakened state and introduces the dangerous inhabitants of Kuraigana Island that he must overcome during his training.

events.title: Mihawk Scares Away the Humandrills
events.description: Just as Zoro is surrounded and about to be overwhelmed, Dracule Mihawk appears. The Humandrills immediately panic and flee in terror at the sight of the world's strongest swordsman.
events.significance: Shows Mihawk's commanding presence and sets up the dynamic between him and Zoro on Kuraigana Island. This moment precedes Zoro eventually asking Mihawk to train him.

events.title: Chopper at Birdie Kingdom
events.description: On Birdie Kingdom, Tony Tony Chopper is captured by a human tribe and attempts to escape. He is stopped by the giant birds, but eventually the tribe befriends both the birds and Chopper.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's situation after being separated by Kuma and his efforts to survive in this strange land populated by giant birds and a primitive human tribe.

events.title: Chopper Receives News of Ace's Death
events.description: After making peace with the tribe and birds, Chopper receives a newspaper from a News Coo. He learns about the tragic fate of Fire Fist Ace at Marineford and is devastated for Luffy.
events.significance: The first Straw Hat crew member shown receiving the devastating news about Ace, establishing the emotional core of the episode as each member learns of their captain's loss.

events.title: Nami Working at Weatheria
events.description: On the sky island Weatheria, Nami is shown working hard labor in the weather fields, cultivating Weather Balls as part of her apprenticeship with Haredas.
events.significance: Depicts Nami's training situation where she is learning advanced weather science that will enhance her navigation and combat abilities.

events.title: Nami Receives News of Ace's Death
events.description: While working at Weatheria, a News Coo arrives and delivers a newspaper to Nami. She reads the horrifying news about what happened at Marineford and Ace's death.
events.significance: Nami's reaction to learning about Ace shows her deep concern for Luffy and the crew's emotional bonds despite being separated.

events.title: Usopp's Weight Gain on Boin Archipelago
events.description: On the Boin Archipelago, Usopp has become severely overweight from eating too much of the island's abundant food, despite his companion Heracles' objections. A News Coo arrives and he knocks it down to get the newspaper.
events.significance: Shows Usopp's tendency to give in to temptation and comfort, contrasting with the harsh training the other Straw Hats are undergoing. This sets up his need for discipline.

events.title: Usopp Receives News of Ace's Death
events.description: After knocking down the News Coo, Usopp reads the newspaper and learns about the tragic events at Marineford and Ace's death before Luffy's eyes.
events.significance: Usopp's reaction shows his concern for Luffy and serves as another emotional beat in the episode's theme of the scattered crew worrying about their captain.

events.title: Sanji as an Okama at Kamabakka Kingdom
events.description: On Kamabakka Kingdom, Sanji has been transformed into an okama (crossdresser), wearing women's clothing and makeup as he watches the sunset. This shows the effect of his time on the island of okamas.
events.significance: Demonstrates the humorous and challenging situation Sanji faces at Kamabakka Kingdom, which becomes motivation for his training to escape and return to normalcy.

events.title: Sanji Receives News and Returns to Normal
events.description: Sanji receives the newspaper about Ace's death and becomes horrified. The shock of the news appears to snap him out of his okama appearance and back to his normal self.
events.significance: Shows that even the traumatic news about Ace has a silver lining in shocking Sanji back to his senses, though the emotional weight of Luffy's loss is paramount.

events.title: Revolutionary Army Meets Robin at Tequila Wolf
events.description: At Tequila Wolf, Nico Robin is talking to members of the Revolutionary Army who ask her to come with them. They reveal they have information about the Straw Hat Pirates and inform Robin about the news from Marineford.
events.significance: This is the only canon scene in the episode. It establishes the Revolutionary Army's interest in Robin and their connection to her Ohara heritage, calling her the 'Light of the Revolution.' Sets up her eventual meeting with Dragon.

events.title: Robin Chooses to Reunite with Her Crew
events.description: Despite the Revolutionary Army's invitation to join them, Robin politely declines, stating she must reunite with her crew. The Revolutionary Army respects her decision and allows her to return to the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's unwavering loyalty to the Straw Hat crew and shows that her true family is with Luffy and the others, not with the Revolutionary Army despite their shared history.

events.title: Franky Discovers Cola on Karakuri Island
events.description: On Karakuri Island, Franky finally finds some cola and defeats an animal he encountered inside Dr. Vegapunk's laboratory. A piece of paper is printed out, revealing the news about Marineford.
events.significance: Shows Franky exploring Dr. Vegapunk's technology on Karakuri Island, which will lead to his upgrades during the timeskip.

events.title: Franky Receives News of Ace's Death
events.description: Through the printed paper from Vegapunk's lab, Franky learns about the tragic events at Marineford and Ace's death.
events.significance: Franky's reaction to the news shows his concern for Luffy despite being separated, maintaining the episode's emotional throughline.

events.title: Brook Composing Music in Harahettania
events.description: In Harahettania (also known as Hungaria), Brook is shown composing music and attempting to do a 45-degree angle pose but ends up doing 60 degrees instead, providing some comic relief.
events.significance: Shows Brook continuing his musical pursuits even while separated from the crew, maintaining his cheerful skeleton persona.

events.title: Brook Receives News of Ace's Death
events.description: Brook receives a newspaper and learns about the devastating news from Marineford regarding Ace's death.
events.significance: Even the ever-cheerful Brook is affected by the news, showing the universal impact of Ace's death on all the Straw Hats.

events.title: Mihawk Explains Ace's Death to Zoro
events.description: Back at Kuraigana Island, Dracule Mihawk explains to Zoro why Luffy was at Marineford and tells him what all of the Straw Hats found out: that Luffy's brother, 'Fire Fist' Ace, died before Luffy's eyes.
events.significance: This conversation provides context for viewers and Zoro about the war at Marineford, Ace's relationship to Luffy, and the gravity of what happened. It also shows Mihawk's awareness of world events.

events.title: All Straw Hats Think of Their Captain
events.description: The episode concludes by showing all the scattered Straw Hat crew members, despite their own unique problems and situations, with their thoughts immediately turning to their crestfallen captain Luffy and his tragic loss.
events.significance: This moment emphasizes the deep bonds between the Straw Hat crew members and their loyalty to Luffy. Even separated across the world, they are united in their concern for their captain.

themes.description: Despite being scattered across the world in different locations, all the Straw Hat crew members are united in their concern for Luffy upon learning of Ace's death. This demonstrates the deep bonds that tie the crew together regardless of physical distance.
themes.symbolism: The newspapers delivered by News Coos serve as the thread connecting all the separated crew members, showing how information travels in the One Piece world and bringing them together emotionally even when they are apart.

themes.description: The episode focuses on the crew's reactions to learning about Ace's death at Marineford, showing how devastating news affects people differently but universally impacts those who care.
themes.symbolism: Each crew member's reaction shot creates a montage of shared grief, emphasizing that loss affects everyone regardless of their individual circumstances.

themes.description: Each Straw Hat is shown in challenging training situations (Zoro fighting Humandrills, Nami doing hard labor, Usopp battling obesity, Sanji dealing with okamas, etc.), setting up their individual growth during the timeskip.
themes.symbolism: The various islands represent different types of trials each crew member must overcome to become stronger.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro is shown struggling against the Humandrills on Kuraigana Island, demonstrating his weakened state post-Thriller Bark. His interaction with Mihawk sets up his future training.
keyActions: Battles against Humandrills while still injured
Is saved by Mihawk's intimidating presence
Learns about Ace's death from Mihawk

characterSpotlights.development: Robin faces a crucial decision when the Revolutionary Army invites her to join them, but she chooses her crew over her ideological allies, showing her complete loyalty to the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Meets with Revolutionary Army members at Tequila Wolf
Declines their invitation to join them
Affirms her commitment to reuniting with the Straw Hat crew

mangaDifferences.difference: Most of the episode is anime-original filler content. Only Robin's scene with the Revolutionary Army at Tequila Wolf contains manga-canon material.

The specific reactions of each Straw Hat crew member (Zoro, Nami, Usopp, Sanji, Chopper, Franky, Brook) to receiving the news about Ace are anime-original content created to expand on the manga's brief coverage.
mangaDifferences.mangaReference: Briefly mentioned in manga but not shown in detail

trivia.fact: Episode 506 is classified as anime-canon/filler, with only Robin's scene at Tequila Wolf being directly from the manga. The rest was created by Toei Animation to show the crew's reactions.
This episode aired during a period (episodes 279-1070) when One Piece did not have ending themes. The anime only featured opening songs during this time to allow for longer episodes.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Humandrills shown in this episode are highly intelligent primates capable of learning and mimicking human combat techniques. They learned to use weapons by watching conflicts on Kuraigana Island.
The preview for the next episode was shortened from its usual duration in this episode.
This episode takes place during the Post-War Arc, which serves as a transition between the first half and second half of One Piece, setting up the two-year timeskip.
